addon_info.name: Blaze Sets
addon_info.author: Cr8-xyz <thamsanqa.dev@gmail.com>
addon_info.description: AI-capable multi-registry asset addon with direct API access for fast asset search across Polyhaven, BlenderKit, and more

ai_integration.agent_description: Multi-Registry Asset Manager provides lightning-fast access to multiple asset libraries including Polyhaven's free high-quality PBR assets (HDRIs, textures, models) and BlenderKit's premium community assets. I can intelligently search, select, download and apply assets with AI-powered scoring based on relevance, quality, popularity, and ratings. The system supports multiple registries through a unified interface, allowing seamless access to both free and premium asset sources.

tools.name: search_polyhaven_assets
tools.description: Search Polyhaven's free asset library using natural language queries with immediate results via direct API calls
tools.usage: Use when user wants to find free high-quality assets from Polyhaven. Provides instant search results with AI-driven quality scoring and relevance ranking. Polyhaven offers professionally created PBR materials, HDRIs, and 3D models.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Natural language search keywords describing what to find (e.g. 'modern wooden table', 'brick texture', 'sunset HDR', 'outdoor HDRI')

parameters.name: asset_type
parameters.description: Type of asset to search for

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: Comma-separated category filter (e.g. 'outdoor,brick' or 'indoor,natural')

examples: search for modern furniture models
find weathered wood textures
get outdoor HDR environments
search for brick textures in outdoor category

tools.name: download_polyhaven_asset
tools.description: Download a specific Polyhaven asset by ID and optionally import it to the current scene
tools.usage: Use to download specific assets by ID from Polyhaven search results, with automatic scene placement and import

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: Polyhaven asset ID from search results

parameters.name: import_to_scene
parameters.description: Whether to automatically import the asset to the current Blender scene

parameters.name: location_x
parameters.description: X coordinate for asset placement in 3D space

parameters.name: location_y
parameters.description: Y coordinate for asset placement in 3D space

parameters.name: location_z
parameters.description: Z coordinate for asset placement in 3D space

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Asset resolution quality

parameters.name: file_format
parameters.description: Specific file format (hdr, exr, jpg, png, gltf, etc.) - auto-detected if not specified

examples: download asset abandoned_factory_01 in 4k resolution
download asset brick_wall_01 and place at coordinates 2,0,0
download asset sunset_hdri in HDR format

tools.name: find_and_add_polyhaven_asset
tools.description: Complete workflow: search Polyhaven assets, automatically select the best match using AI scoring, download, and add to scene in one operation
tools.usage: Use for quick one-step asset addition from Polyhaven. AI automatically selects the best matching asset based on relevance, quality, and suitability. Most convenient function for rapid scene enhancement with free high-quality assets.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Natural language description of the desired asset

parameters.name: asset_type
parameters.description: Type of asset to find and add

parameters.name: location_x
parameters.description: X coordinate for asset placement

parameters.name: location_y
parameters.description: Y coordinate for asset placement

parameters.name: location_z
parameters.description: Z coordinate for asset placement

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Asset resolution quality

examples: add a comfortable modern armchair to the living room at position 3,2,0
apply realistic brick wall texture in 4k quality
set dramatic cloudy sky HDR environment
add wooden dining table model in 2k resolution

tools.name: get_polyhaven_categories
tools.description: Get available categories for filtering Polyhaven assets by type
tools.usage: Use to discover available asset categories for more targeted searches. Helps users understand what types of assets are available.

parameters.name: asset_type
parameters.description: Asset type to get categories for

examples: get texture categories from polyhaven
show available model categories
list all asset categories

tools.name: apply_polyhaven_texture_to_object
tools.description: Apply a previously downloaded Polyhaven texture to a specific Blender object with automatic PBR material setup
tools.usage: Use to apply downloaded textures to objects in the scene. Creates a complete PBR material with proper node connections for diffuse, normal, roughness, metallic maps, etc.

parameters.name: object_name
parameters.description: Name of the Blender object to apply texture to

parameters.name: texture_asset_id
parameters.description: Polyhaven texture asset ID that was previously downloaded

examples: apply texture brick_wall_01 to object Cube
apply downloaded wood texture to table object
set metal texture on sphere object

tools.name: search_assets
tools.description: Generic search function that can search across different registries (currently Polyhaven, BlenderKit support coming)
tools.usage: Use for registry-agnostic asset searches. Allows specifying which registry to search while maintaining consistent interface.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Natural language search query

parameters.name: asset_type
parameters.description: Type of asset to search for

parameters.name: registry
parameters.description: Registry to search in

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: Comma-separated category filter

examples: search polyhaven for modern furniture
find brick textures in polyhaven registry
search for outdoor HDRIs with limit 5

tools.name: download_asset
tools.description: Generic download function that can download assets from different registries with automatic import and scene integration
tools.usage: Use for registry-agnostic asset downloads. Supports different registries while maintaining consistent interface.

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: Asset identifier from search results

parameters.name: registry

parameters.name: import_to_scene

parameters.description: Y coordinate for placement

parameters.name: location_z

parameters.name: resolution

parameters.name: file_format

examples: download asset chair_01 from polyhaven in 2k resolution

tools.name: list_scene_objects
tools.description: Get comprehensive list of all objects currently in the Blender scene for spatial planning and object reference
tools.usage: Use before positioning operations to see what objects are available. Essential for understanding scene composition and planning spatial relationships.
examples: list all objects in the scene
show me what objects are available
get scene inventory for spatial planning
check what objects I can work with

tools.name: process_inbox_assets
tools.description: Process and download assets from the user's inbox context
tools.usage: Automatically download all assets from the user's inbox that are ready for download

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Asset resolution quality for all downloads

parameters.name: import_to_scene
parameters.description: Whether to automatically import downloaded assets to the scene

parameters.name: clear_inbox_after_processing
parameters.description: Whether to automatically clear the inbox after successful processing

examples: download all my inbox assets in 2k resolution
process my inbox and import everything to the scene
download inbox assets without importing to scene
process inbox and keep items for later use

tools.name: get_objects_by_type
tools.description: Filter scene objects by type for targeted spatial operations and better scene organization
tools.usage: Use to focus on specific object types when planning scene layouts. Helps identify furniture vs decorations vs lighting for systematic positioning.

parameters.name: asset_type
parameters.description: Type of objects to filter for

examples: get all mesh objects for furniture arrangement
list all lights for lighting setup
show all camera objects
filter objects by type for organization

tools.name: transform_resize
tools.description: Resize/scale selected objects with precise control over each axis
tools.usage: Use to scale selected objects in the scene. Provides precise control over scaling factors for each axis with optional axis constraints and snapping.

parameters.name: value_x
parameters.description: Scale factor for X axis

parameters.name: value_y
parameters.description: Scale factor for Y axis

parameters.name: value_z
parameters.description: Scale factor for Z axis

parameters.name: constraint_x
parameters.description: Lock transformation to X axis only

parameters.name: constraint_y
parameters.description: Lock transformation to Y axis only

parameters.name: constraint_z
parameters.description: Lock transformation to Z axis only

parameters.name: snap
parameters.description: Enable snapping during transformation

parameters.name: snap_target
parameters.description: Snap target for alignment

examples: scale selected objects by 2x in all dimensions
resize object to half size on X axis only
scale furniture by 1.5x with snapping enabled
resize object with constraints on Y axis only

tools.name: transform_translate
tools.description: Translate/move selected objects in 3D space with precise positioning
tools.usage: Use to move selected objects in the scene. Provides precise control over movement values for each axis with optional axis constraints and snapping.

parameters.name: value_x
parameters.description: Translation value for X axis

parameters.name: value_y
parameters.description: Translation value for Y axis

parameters.name: value_z
parameters.description: Translation value for Z axis

parameters.name: constraint_x
parameters.description: Lock transformation to X axis only

parameters.name: constraint_y
parameters.description: Lock transformation to Y axis only

parameters.name: constraint_z
parameters.description: Lock transformation to Z axis only

parameters.name: snap
parameters.description: Enable snapping during transformation

parameters.name: snap_target
parameters.description: Snap target for alignment

examples: move selected objects 2 units along X axis
position object at coordinates 1,2,3
move furniture with snapping to nearest object
translate object with constraints on Z axis only

tools.name: transform_rotate
tools.description: Rotate selected objects to absolute rotation values on X, Y, Z axes
tools.usage: Use to set absolute rotation of selected objects in the scene. Provides precise control over rotation angles on all three axes with optional constraints and snapping.

parameters.name: value_x
parameters.description: Absolute rotation value in radians for X axis

parameters.name: value_y
parameters.description: Absolute rotation value in radians for Y axis

parameters.name: value_z
parameters.description: Absolute rotation value in radians for Z axis

parameters.name: constraint_x
parameters.description: Lock transformation to X axis only

parameters.name: constraint_y
parameters.description: Lock transformation to Y axis only

parameters.name: constraint_z
parameters.description: Lock transformation to Z axis only

parameters.name: snap
parameters.description: Enable snapping during transformation

parameters.name: snap_target
parameters.description: Snap target for alignment

examples: rotate selected object to 45 degrees on Z axis: value_z=0.785
set object rotation to 90 degrees on X and Y: value_x=1.57, value_y=1.57
rotate object to specific angles with snapping enabled
set absolute rotation with constraints on Y axis only

tools.name: set_active_object
tools.description: Make an object the active object in the scene
tools.usage: Use to set a specific object as the active object, which is often required before performing operations on it

parameters.name: object_name
parameters.description: Name of the object to make active

examples: set Cube as the active object
make Chair_01 the active object
activate object Light_Sun
select Table_Master as active object

tools.name: focus_on_active_object
tools.description: Focus the 3D view on the currently active object
tools.usage: Use to center the 3D viewport view on the currently active object for better visibility and navigation
examples: focus the view on the active object
center camera on selected object
zoom to active object
frame the active object in viewport

tools.name: select_object
tools.description: Select an object in the scene
tools.usage: Use to select a specific object in the Blender scene, optionally deselecting other objects first

parameters.name: object_name
parameters.description: Name of the object to select

parameters.name: deselect_others
parameters.description: Whether to deselect other objects first

examples: select the chair object
select Table_01 and deselect others
choose object Light_Rig
pick Cube and keep other selections

tools.name: delete_object
tools.description: Delete an object from the scene
tools.usage: Use to remove objects from the current scene

parameters.name: object_name
parameters.description: The name of the object to delete

examples: delete the cube object
remove the light from the scene
delete chair model
